text: Pours a dark brown with a khaki lacing that dissipates incredible quick. Aroma is habenero, chocolate, coconut,vanilla and bourbon. Definitely some heat from the alcohol and peppers. Body is thin

March 25, 2016. Bottle at Himmeriget.
Black with a very small tan head. Aroma is quite bourbon forward, toffee, vanilla, roasted coconut, burnt wood, dark chocolate and some cinnamon. Taste is medium sweet, slight boozy, soft roasted bitterness, light spicy notes and a touch of chili heat. Finish is warming bourbon alcohol, slightly increasing chili heat, sweet caramel and vanilla notes and soft bitter dark chocolate, light cinnamon and coconut. 

Good, lots of bourbon notes.

Pours black with minimal tanned head 
Aromas lovely of fruity and chocolate chilies , brown sugar, dark maltyness, hints of bourbon barrel , cinnamon, vanilla 
Taste has brilliant notes of chocolate, fruity ancho chilies, brown sugar , light bourbon notes, cinnamon  
Mouthfeel is smooth, velvety with low bitterness, low carbonation, medium sweetness

Pours black with flat, deep tan head. Aroma of chilli, vanilla, mild bourbon, chocolate, cedar wood, mild cinnamon, just wow wow wow. Taste is sweet, mild spicy and hot, light chocolate and vanilla and then turning into a long bourbon boozy finish. The cinnamon, chocolate and chilli still lingers, mind you. One of the most complex and delightful beers Ive ever had. Rich and creamy smooth body with soft carbonation, but that should go without saying.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, habanero chili, roasted malt, bourbon, oak, muscovado sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, caramel. Taste is quite sweet with chocolate notes, nutty notes and caramel biscuit notes, chili notes towards the end. Mouthfeel is insanely smooth and velvety with a very low carbonation, yet somewhat dry. Stupid good!

Bottle bought at Himmeriget copenhagen, and shared with someone at the bar, poured pitch black in colour with a Nice mocha ring on the site, such an oily an vicious pour! Smell is bursting with layers. First is sweet intense pappy bourbon without getting to dominant. Sweet sticky chocolate molasses, heat, chocolate cookies, vanilla, sticky fudge, coconut, sweet cinnamon. Taste is sweetness upfront, sweet cinnamon Rolls, chocolate fudge, a lot of sweet pappy bourbon, clear pepper heat, and Some vanilla sweetness in the back. This is the best magican cake version i have ever tried! And ive had a lot of them. There i such an amazing sweet and Unique bourbon barrel sweetness, but the base beer is still so prominent in a good way. One of the most balanced barrel aged beers, perfect heat finish with a full sticky mouthfeel. Its worth every Penny ive paid for it. Wonderful beer!

CBCNOR bottleshare at Himmeriget, may 12th 2016. Black body with a beige head. Aroma is malty with chocolate, courbon, chili and raisin. Strong bitterness, mild chili burn, licorice, sweet cakes and heavy coffee in taste. Woody finish with a high boozyness, lasting bourbon and choco aftertaste. A little harsher than the bourbon version, which I remember as smoother.
[5/11/16] Bottle sample at Himmeriget in Copenhagen. Black. Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, cinnamon, more spices. Sweet, spicy. Thick.

650 ml bottle at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Black color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, licorice, spicy, cinnamon, light chili, coconut, vanilla, wood, light alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste, spicy chocolate cake like aroma. Medium to full silky body with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours near opaque black with a thin brown head which disappears quickly. Aroma is caramel, molasses, cocoa, vanilla and coconut. Taste is heavy caramel sweet, coconut, slight roast, cocoa bitter, slight liquorice, creme brulee.

Black with a small chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, coconut, treacle, vanilla, chocolate cake. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, sweet and complex on the palate with a long chocolatey finish. Taste is chocolate cake, bourbon, cinnamon, vanilla, prunes, coconut.

Bottle thanks to Seth. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong bourbon, wood, peppers, roast. Thick mouth, chewy, roast, peppers, dark chocolate, bourbon, nice heat, very nice.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - pours black with a small dissipating tanned brown head. Comprises roasted malts, with intense rich chocolate, fudge, toffee, caramel, some lovely coconut sensations, vanilla, some earthy and burnt malty hits, bourbon and wooden notes, again chilli heat is there but reserved and not overpowering, really loved this one, really worked for me. Immense.

Thanks to hackobock & _angst_ for looking out for me big time!
A: Deep deep dark brown almost pitch black, hint of light brown head. N: Vanilla, cinnamon, bourbon T: Cinnamon, chili heat, vanilla, oak, ash, bourbon, coconut O: Overwhelming oak and a bit too boozy for me. Less on the nose than I expected it to be, but still a great stout!

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours oily black with a small creamy mocha head that leaves some sparse spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, roasty, slightly spicy, slightly nutty and boozy with roasted malts, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, luxurious dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, coconut milk, cinnamon, smoked chilis and plenty of thick alost buttery bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and tiny spicy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, oily, tiny astringent, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted toffee malts, rich buttery bourbon and hints of cinnamon and smoked chilis. Great BBA impy. Perhaps a bit heavy on the barrel character.
Bottle pour. Dark pour with brown head. Cinnamon, coffee, pepper, chocolate and vanilla aromas. Sweet vanilla and chocolate, cinnamon, spice, heat and bourbon Flavors.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ Himmeriget. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma is surprisingly subtle compared to the other Cake variants. Roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice root, oak, cinnamon, vanilla, chili, caramel, not enough pappy to detect and somehow a hint of lavender. Taste medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, a little too thin texture, soft carbonation. Finish is mild chili, alcohol, oak and slightly dry.
Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pitch black pour with a dark tan head. Notes of milky chocolate, caramel, coconut, light subtle spices, cinnamon bun and some light roast. Pretty gewd!

Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours a pitch black with a small, tan head. Aroma has cinnamon, vanilla, caramel, bourbon, milk chocolate, fudge, sweet english licorice, roasty malts, some spice. Taste is sweet, smooth, spicy, caramel, elegantly boozy, chili in the finish. Smoothest texture amongst the variants IMO. Average carbonation. Lovely!

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours black with a tiny brown head. Not as stunning looking as the rest. Aroma of deep bourbon notes, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, cocoa, vanilla and slight toffee as well. More subtle than the others on the spice note - a bit like the red wine version but I like the bourbon domination more here. The taste has big bourbon notes, some chili heat, chocolate, roasted malts, cocoa beans, weak cinnamon and some warming alcohol towards the end. This spoke to me in strange ways. Absolutely awesome.

Bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. 

Pours pitch black with a small shortlasting dark brown head.

Aromas of cinnamon, coconut, vanilla, fudge, dough, cocoa, dark chocolate, caramel, chilies in the back. Definitely get the barrel characters, but not overwhelming.

Taste is bourbon up front, cinnamon, dry cocoa, chilies, walnuts, burned wood, fudge, roasty, light boozy, dry finish. I had hoped for wayyyy more barrel. Expected Assassin + MC but still a very nice beer.

Pour jet black, with a small off white head. 
Aroma has slight coconut, slight chili spice and head, Wood and vanilla, chocolate fudge brownie dough, pappy goodness. 
Taste is slightly sweet up front, slight heat and roasted bitter notes. 
Medium Body, with a very fitting flat carb. I would have wished for more pappy, but maybe Im just spolied.

22oz bottle. Thanks for sharing Vark, this was a nice suprise. Black with a thin ring around the edge. Lots of bourbon, chocolate, pepper spices, oaky vanilla. Barrel is definitely present but very mellow and smooth. This one retained a lot more of the pepper and spices which complimented the super smooth bourbon perfectly. Was really surprised by this one. Didnt think that the 2014 variants lives up to the hype, the base stout which I loved was too muted by the barrel. Not the case in this one. Perfect blend of the amazing base stout with a great barrel.
